reviews.author: dave ross
reviews.text: Great sonics great vocals sometimes harsh mostly clean. My initial feeling was Corey Taylor ditching Slipknot to join the Palm Desert scene

reviews.author: 051R158
reviews.text: Thanks for this Album. It had to grow on me. I Love it.eh Milkaholic seriously ? Is about drinking Milk !? i dont know if this is something to sing about. maybe you could explain it to me.

reviews.author: Harry Harrison
reviews.text: Well it looks like the second outing from Void Droid has given us a unanimous decision on their genre of choice……………Stoner Groove Metal it is. They remind me of an angrier version of their countrymen, ‘Planet of Zeus’ or a sped-up version of ‘Soundcrawler’. Whatever the comparisons, it sounds good. Not the music you take home to Mum though. Favorite track: Martian Architect.

reviews.author: Harry Harrison
reviews.text: One part Stoner Groove Metal! One part Stoner Metal Grunge! One part Stoner……err……Ballard? The upside is that it’s 3 parts awesome and that’s 100% goodness. As Void Droid’s first outing, it feels like a band finding their way in their sonic journey. It doesn’t really matter which way they go, they’re equally talented in all those genres. No pigeonholing at the moment. Let's see were they go with this. Favorite track: Praying Mantis.

reviews.author: Soshanna ♥
reviews.text: Two tracks of heavy hitting stoner metal, and one track, the last song is a haunting, stunningly beautiful vocal & guitar arrangement that leaves me breathless and goosebumps all over. What a voice this guy has! Bravo! Favorite track: Little Droid's Blues.

reviews.author: Morts
reviews.text: Riff-o-rama!! While it's possible for someone to think this may be just another stoner/groove metal release, by really giving this a listen you realise how bloody great the delivery is, how full of feeling and enthusiasm! Belying the band's name, this music is anything but empty or robotic. Check it out and enjoy! Favorite track: Praying Mantis.

reviews.author: FDJ
reviews.text: Hard hitting retro-rock from Greece with some nice riffs and a good vocal. Greece is really turning out some good stoner bands of late! Favorite track: Praying Mantis.

reviews.author: I'm joining a cult.
reviews.text: Like QotSA, but with lamb meat gyros. Favorite track: Modern Panic.

reviews.author: tyler97
reviews.text: Excellent Album! Please don't change your style, I love the hard hitting and catchy songs. Favorite track: Dance Like a Reptile.

tracklist.trackName: ...And We Just Pressed The Alarm Button

reviews.author: nick_ark
reviews.text: Just love it! Favorite track: Backseats.

reviews.author: ntokanion
reviews.text: What can I say... This is very underrated. They deserve worldwide status :) Favorite track: Revolving Doors.

reviews.author: Old Man Doom
reviews.text: Happened upon these fellers on my feed and found myself mesmerized by the riffs. This is one excellent album for the drive to the hunting cabin, the sweat lodge, or your favorite bootleggers hideaway. Favorite track: Backseats.

reviews.author: zombiejoe
reviews.text: Although not as good as the original versions, it's fun to hear such a different and quiet take! Thank you for releasing this! Favorite track: Modern Panic (Live Rework).

reviews.author: Icewurm
reviews.text: Broke out their acoustic lounge vibe on this one and it works Favorite track: Modern Panic (Live Rework)

reviews.author: Mike Williams
reviews.text: Four amazing covers. The Neptune Power Federation, if the creative well ever runs dry and they’re looking for an idea for a new album, they’d surely make a KILLER 70s hard rock cover band and could produce an album’s worth of amazing Deep Purple, Budgie, Cactus, Sir Lord Baltimore, Blue Cheer, Bang, etc. cover tunes. This is one of the best releases of 2020, and it’s only a double 7”. Favorite track: Kill The King.

tracklist.trackName: Flying Incendiary Club For Subjugating Demons
I'll Make A Man Out Of You

reviews.author: schmoerfer
reviews.text: Thanks for the great Gig at Hell over Hammaburg '19!

reviews.author: Mot
reviews.text: What a great album! Lovin it

reviews.author: Jacqueline Hyde
reviews.text: I like to imagine this song is dedicated to G. Pell. He can definitely Go to Hell. Favorite track: Bound For Hell.

reviews.author: Charlie Hodgson
reviews.text: That's the way of the wizard mutha fucka...., this album will pleasure your hearing holes for the whole duration of the album releasing lots of dopamine and leaving you in a state of fuzzy ecstasy. Favorite track: Way Of The Wizard.

reviews.author: sleeptalker
reviews.text: Why it took so long for me to buy this album is beyond me. Strongly recommended. Favorite track: Sup Thy Potion.

reviews.author: Mike Williams
reviews.text: Picked this album up a second time to get the gatefold edition. This is one of the best bands going today. Balls out in your face cosmic fuzz rock. Favorite track: Opium Den.

reviews.author: mAnarchist
reviews.text: TNPF struck gold/platinum/jewels when they added Loz on vocals. Total killer album!

reviews.author: hackiausbruch
reviews.text: This is THE BAND! Favorite track: The Man From Tomorrow.

reviews.author: Mike Williams
reviews.text: This band has risen to become one of my top five favorite groups active today, along with Monster Magnet, Clutch, The Atomic Bitchwax, and Iron Maiden, heady company. The debut was good, but adding High Priestess Screaming Loz Sutch as vocalist brought this group to a whole new level. Favorite track: Mothership.

reviews.author: Mike Williams
reviews.text: A tremendous debut from Satan's house band, prior to the arrival of the Imperial Priestess Screamin' Loz Sutch. Some killer material still though, check out the title cut, The Fuzz, Boil the Oil, Shazam! In the Van, and Wizard Lovin'. They give a snapshot of future efforts with a new singer. Favorite track: The Fuzz.

reviews.author: drokter awesome
reviews.text: Music, come back to Germany soon, Cologne would be great !! Favorite track: Skies Of Sound.

title: Flying Incendiary Club / I Put A Spell On You

tracklist.trackName: I Put A Spell On You
Flying Incendiary Club For Subjugating Demons

reviews.author: Mike Williams
reviews.text: Grab this to pick up the rare bonus track, a balls out cover of I Put a Spell On You. Favorite track: I Put A Spell On You.

reviews.author: youtrippin
reviews.text: Burnt? Liquid? I love them both! Favorite track: Burnt Sleep.

reviews.author: BaZaz
reviews.text: Liquid Sleep is one of the best stoner songs on the planet! Favorite track: Liquid Sleep.

reviews.author: zzzptm
reviews.text: 1000mods ought to be in your collection, as well. Favorite track: Burnt Sleep.

reviews.author: youtrippin
reviews.text: Dani, what the fuck are you saying? Favorite track: Valley of Sand.

reviews.author: Charon66
reviews.text: Very rare, very early recording, before the fame, still with a high potential

reviews.author: SOUNY
reviews.text: làààààà, on est bien lààààà....c'est planant... mmmmmhhhh c'est tripant, c'est coooool... aahhhhhh, ouiiiiiiii oh yeahhhhh Favorite track: Valley of Sand.

reviews.author: dave ross
reviews.text: Good way to mark 200 up Favorite track: Vidage.

reviews.author: trapeze1
reviews.text: A fine album! Stay safe and well.... Favorite track: Vidage.

reviews.author: Steve
reviews.text: 'Vidage' was not only my intro song to 1000mods, but to much of the stoner rock I listen to now. My gateway song. I still freakin love it. But their harder stuff like Road to Burn & Abell 1835 are more my speed. This band fucking rocks on every album. The jams in the longer songs always get my head banging. Keep the music coming boys. You set the standard for me. And opened doors for a lot of other bands I would bet. Favorite track: Road to Burn.

reviews.author: photosynthefy
reviews.text: I really like 1000 mods....what sparked my interest was the song 'She'. I love everything about that song. I think it's a masterpiece. I like that every song on this album has got its differences and they are masterfully crafted to bring your ear holes pure pleasure. These are only my opinions of course so feel free to bring your very own ears holes for a wild ride and test this most wonderful album out for yourself. Favorite track: She.

reviews.author: milanhash
reviews.text: it's a banger

reviews.author: easterncrow
reviews.text: Consistent as expected; slamming where it matters. Favorite track: Claws.

reviews.author: Alrihkh
reviews.text: Among the best heavy rock bands in existence today. The guitar tones are so awesome! So heavy! And the vocals are perfectly suited to the mean fuzz. The drumming is done just right, too. Not overdone, just a good pummelling. Love it! Thank you, 1000mods! 9/10. Favorite track: Loose.

reviews.author: takhov
reviews.text: Killing Fookin Riffs Favorite track: Into the Spell.

reviews.author: heckgermany
reviews.text: Electric Carve introduced me to this Greek powerhouse, and that led me to other great Greek bands. They're killing it on this record! Favorite track: Electric Carve.

reviews.author: edolaraza
reviews.text: The album was co-produced with Matt Bayles, and you'll can immediately understand it. It has a very American soul, but with Greeks roots. Here 1000 Mods prove that they wanna to go really high, and will make it. Thank you for this another pearl. Favorite track: Dissent.

reviews.author: Charon66
reviews.text: So the 1000Mods are back and I can't say, they got better. But that's impossible after these last three iconic albums, which are still part of my all-time favs. But they made it again and evolved their sound slightly. Still love these concise riffs so much. A must have

reviews.author: Dimitris Adraktas
reviews.text: this 'modern' Stoner sound is awesome!!! Rock it out🤘🤘🤘🤘love and peace ✌️ Favorite track: So many days.

reviews.author: Whayta
reviews.text: Sounds better on stream than flac format..more powerful. Great album!!!

reviews.author: Fuzzy goat
reviews.text: Black woods is one of the more representative track of the stoner-doom genre. Pure Black Sabbath heritage

reviews.author: PeacemakerofthemostHigh
reviews.text: It's a shadowing echo of my inner soul. Something dear, no one can take; but, everyone can feel. Not by touch, but, by emotion. Favorite track: I'm The Mountain.

reviews.author: Valentyn Riabukhin
reviews.text: You guys are super-cool and I'm proud of Ukrainian production! I wish you to continue to make quality content ;) Favorite track: Indian.

reviews.author: Carol McCuller
reviews.text: A favorite band and album. Favorite track: I'm The Mountain.

artists.name: Igor Sydorenko
artists.role: vocals, guitars, Hammond organ, occasional keyboards and percussion

reviews.author: infinitesunrise
reviews.text: A perfectly refreshing mix of garage-style stoner rock and doom, oscillating back and forth between the two with several other influences thrown in for taste. Really digging these guy's refusal to fully commit to any of the genres they draw from, instead using the best parts of each to create an addictive, chord-heavy head-banging stoner amalgamation that will hook you in at some point, one way or another. Favorite track: Here Come the Robots.

reviews.author: Valentyn Riabukhin
reviews.text: Great, heavy and melodic album. You guys are cool as usual! I am proud of Ukrainian production ;) Favorite track: Wound.

reviews.author: Carsten Grossmann
reviews.text: Yum! Ukrainian trio making one hell of a ruckus. Each track a favorite, for the album kicks of with straightforward motorcycle music to slam you into the sunset at full speed. As the ride continues into the night things get progressively weirder, darker and slower. But no less rocking. Oh it's Harvest time allright... Favorite track: Here Come the Robots.

reviews.author: JWAR
reviews.text: This album is amazing just like every effort put out by Stoned Jesus. Water Me is one of my favorites but they are all amazing!! You guys rule!

reviews.author: Mikhail
reviews.text: The best SJ's album (so far) and one of most probable candidates to the 1st place in lot of rock tops of the year (I hope).Great work! Favorite track: Feel.

reviews.author: Dreads Connor
reviews.text: Madmen! this is pure theatrical sillybuggers and I won't be fooled one moment of it! pure love for your lunacy; praise in his name our lord the stoned jesus of ukraine! Favorite track: Feel.

reviews.author: maalmike
reviews.text: great strong, dark sound

reviews.author: wbaveganstoner
reviews.text: Raw, Dirty, Fuzzy, HEAVY!!! what's not to like?

reviews.author: Hilo
reviews.text: I have listened carefully to Occult, one of my First Communion Fetich tracks and I would not know how to decide on the demo or the original track, it is like listening to the same song in a parallel reality ..., I love it, Thank you Jesus !!!

reviews.author: alligator rodeo
reviews.text: Absolutely fantastic! The only weakness might be, that the best song is the opener of the record, but following songs are not bad at all! Favorite track: Strong Reflection.

reviews.author: Matthew
reviews.text: Hooked from the first few bars.... and I love the vocals which add an ethereal, melodic, and almost delicate touch to what is a pretty heavy piece of work. There's real musicianship here too, a great combo. Favorite track: Strong Reflection.

reviews.author: Nik Havert
reviews.text: It's as heavy as white dwarf star matter and as bright as a summer sunrise at the same time. I'm not sure how they did it, but it's great. Here's my full review - www.7thlevelmusic.com?p=6833 Favorite track: Strong Reflection.

reviews.author: Stoner Vibrations
reviews.text: This a great album, reminds me a little of Dead Meadow. Though I feel like MRS has shifted a little more to the Doomy side in their riffs, a slight change from their debut album. Although this is a fantastic album I feel that none of the tracks quite compare with tracks like 'Strong Reflection', 'Way to Rome' or 'Up the stairs' from their first album. Definitely worth a buy though. Favorite track: ARCADIA.

reviews.author: Elliott Mariess
reviews.text: MRS will alway remain a strong favourite in my music collection. They somehow drift seamlessly between dreamy psych to upbeat stoner rock into slow sludgy doomy territories. every album/song is its own journey. Favorite track: JOIN THE RACE.

title: APEX III ( Praise for the Burning Soul )

reviews.author: Michael Reilly
reviews.text: An album that evolves and improves as it unfolds, there's plenty of entertaining space/stoner/psych moments here to enjoy. Mars Red Sky's sound is irresistibly solid, expressively stylish and progressive. Favorite track: FRIENDLY FIRE.

reviews.author: abnormal_listening_habits
reviews.text: This is one of my favorite discoveries of late here on Bc, this site had tons of buried treasure.

reviews.author: Marcin Wielewski
reviews.text: It's one the current bands, that has very uniqe sound, and You can't deceive it with any other band. I've participated two their gigs in Krakow and each one was heavy riffs melted with angel singing. Favorite track: HOLLOW KING.

reviews.author: Michael Reilly
reviews.text: At their best MRS are an almost unstoppable force, powering their way forward with evocative compositions that mix strength and beauty with ease. My faves here are REACTS and CRAZY HEARTH – songs that achieve great balance and intensity: gateways to another world. Favorite track: REACTS.

reviews.author: psygenz
reviews.text: Una auténtica maravilla artística.Discazo.

reviews.author: sonichoosier
reviews.text: As a long time shoe gaze and space rock obsessor, Somali Yacht Club are the perfect blend of these sounds plus so much more. Great band and I am so glad I found them. Can't get enough.

reviews.author: Meredith Avila
reviews.text: Had to pick one track but all the tracks are my favorite while I am listening to them. This music is out of this world. They do everything right. I cannot recommend this album enough. It's the best thing I've heard this year so far and I've heard a lot of good music this year. Favorite track: Blood Leaves a Trail.

reviews.author: Wolf Moon
reviews.text: This band are truly pioneers of their own sound and are bringing exactly what's lacking in Rock music today – innovation. By blending stoner rock/metal with elements of alternative rock, post-rock and progressive rock they have wielded something very unique.A phenomenal sophomore album by one of the greatest bands of the previous decade.

reviews.author: krotix
reviews.text: Very ear filling album that keeps unfolding as it travels along. Also detect bits of Grunge ala Soundgarden so there are also some great keening vocals. Favorite track: Sun.

reviews.author: Christopher Ancarrow
reviews.text: These guys rock! I have listened to this album multiple times and it keeps growing on me, on the top of my list for favorite discovery of this year. Favorite track: Loom.

reviews.author: Zedana
reviews.text: Really loving this. Sends chills down my spine tingling. 😘

tracklist.trackName: Whatever Knows Fear Burns At My Touch
Lift High The Veil Of Maya

reviews.author: titiflopik
reviews.text: ça prend aux tripes, c'est planant, c'est un voyage sonore. les sons, les ambiances s'installent doucement. parfois on chute... on se relève hagard, éparpillé entre monts vagues et merveilles. Favorite track: Lift High The Veil Of Maya.

reviews.author: Alrihkh
reviews.text: Great heavy, blues~tinged stoner rock! The Changing Man begins like a deep premeditation of something heavy about to go down, like the intensifying determination of someone mission~bound. Lyrically, the songs seem like dark contemplations with psychedelic undertones; somewhat mystical and reminiscent of the Doors (think, The End). Musically, Sweven leans towards a heavy stoner vibe. 8/10. Favorite track: (Shades Of) The Changing Man.

reviews.author: sabatolg
reviews.text: I am completely speechless and it’s only my first listening. Love it! Cet album est merveilleux. Félicitations.
